description.narrative: The proposed Project encompasses several autonomous components. The primary economic benefits will be in the economic value added by the overall investment program, as well as possible synergies with the Company existing operations. The various components of the program (soybean crushing, table eggs) do not appear to benefit from excessive levels of effective protection, so that financial and economic returns are likely to be aligned. Other economic impacts will include: (i) additional taxes; (ii) additional employment; (iii) additional reach to MSMEs, and, (iv) additional reach to farmers, although most of the new projects will rely on imported agricultural raw materials of which Egypt has been a major importer. Development outcome indicators will include (i) the project FRR and ERR, (ii) employment including female employment, (iii) taxes paid, and (iv) number of farmers and MSMEs reached.

Wadi Holdings Company (SAE) (Wadi or the company) and its thirteen subsidiaries comprise a group of Egyptian companies which, has three core business activities. The first of these consists of poultry operations. The second core activity is the planting, cultivating, harvesting and processing of olives and other vegetables and fruits. The third core activities is the production of glass, poultry feed and other industrial products. Wadi is now implementing a two-year expansion and diversification investment program, which includes: (i) setting up a soybean crushing plant in Noubaria, Egypt to support its feed mill operations; (ii) expansion of table eggs production from 70 million to 650 million eggs per annum by 2012; (iii) construction of a mono-calcium phosphate (feed ingredient) plant; (iv) construction of a plant to assemble trailers; and (v) development of a fish production project.

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. Ramzi Nasrallah or Mr. Tony Freiji, both of whom can be contacted at wadi@wadigroup.com.eg and (202) 3304-3837 or (202) 3304-3839.

name.narrative: The company is headquartered in Giza of Egypt and has 13 subsidiaries in Egypt. The concerned subprojects will be located along the Cairo-Alexandria Dessert Road.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
